Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 499-2 Filed 11/23/21 Page 35 of 15934
LBAGmax2 Rocchio - Direct
1 of money, and if you are giving them something that will
2 increase their dependency. Also the adult-child relationship,
3 the power differential.
4 THE COURT: The specific examples you are mentioning,
5 are those found in the literature?
6 THE WITNESS: They are.
7
8 THE COURT: So you derive your views as to those
9 specific examples from -- not from your clinical work or your
10 forensic work or maybe both -- but the ones you have cited just
11 now, you find in peer-reviewed literature?
12 THE WITNESS: Yes. It's an interaction. So
13 everything I'm talking about today is derived from my education
14 and experience, as well as my knowledge of the literature. But
15 yes, for many years, those specific tactics and strategies have
16 been described in numerous peer-reviewed articles.
17 And your Honor, if I may, it's also, I believe
18 important to know that those are articles that have studied
19 reports and behaviors that offenders talk about doing as well
20 as things that victims have talked about experiencing.
21 THE COURT: Thank you.
22 BY MS. POMERANTZ:
23 Q. Dr. Rocchio, you gave an example of gift giving, how can
24 you tell if that is grooming or innocent behavior?
25 A. As I said, it depends on the context in which the gift giving is happening. And you have to look at the entire
